substeps.title: Gather your supplies
substeps.description:
Choose a clean, well-lit area where you always prepare your IV equipment. Make sure you have the following items:
• Hand sanitizer
• Surface disinfectant
• Your prescribed treatment (infusion pump or pre-filled syringes)
• Pre-filled saline flushes
• Tray or clean work surface
• Clean tissues or paper towels
If anything is missing, contact your healthcare provider before starting.

substeps.title: Wash your hands
substeps.description: Wash your hands carefully according to the hand hygiene guide.
substeps.moreInfo: Clean hands are your best protection against infection. Do this before handling any equipment.

substeps.title: Take medication out of the fridge
substeps.description: Take your medication out of the fridge before your infusion to let it reach room temperature. Some pumps need 2 hours, others only 15–30 minutes depending on tubing and model. Follow the instructions from your nurse or the label on your pump packaging.
substeps.moreInfo: Never place the pump at the back of the fridge — it may freeze. Keep it in a clean ziploc bag while stored.

substeps.title: Check the medication label
substeps.description: Make sure the label matches your name, the medication, and the dose. Check the expiration date.
substeps.moreInfo: If anything is incorrect or unclear, do not use the medication and contact your nurse or pharmacy.

substeps.title: Inspect the medication and flushes
substeps.description: Make sure the pump or syringes are intact. Do not use them if damaged, leaking, discolored, or if they contain particles. Check your saline flushes the same way.

steps.title: Step 3: Set Up Your Work Area

substeps.title: Disinfect the surface
substeps.description: Disinfect your work surface, including your mobile phone. Dry everything with a clean paper towel.
substeps.moreInfo: Use a disinfectant wipe or spray approved for surfaces. Avoid placing equipment on wet areas.

substeps.title: Open supplies
substeps.description: Remove your pump, syringes, and flushes from their packaging and place them on the clean work surface.
